DOC.brief_title: Oral Nutrition Supplementation in Hospitalized Patients
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose of this pilot study is to determine the effect of 3 months use of enhanced Oral Nutritional Supplementation (ONS) on muscle accretion and functional performance in malnourished elderly patients. The objectives of this study are to determine feasibility of recruitment, adherence to intervention and retention of the sample, as well as the capacity of subjects to complete functional and muscle mass measures for a planned multi-centre Randomized Controlled Trial (RCT).
DOC.criteria: admitted to a general medical ward and recruited within 48 hours over the age of 65 years malnourished (subjective global assessment categories B or C patients) have an allergy or intolerance to any component of the oral supplement are designated palliative care are currently suffering from refeeding syndrome have a preexisting medical condition that prevents oral intake of full fluids, have an expected length of stay of less than 48 hours from the time of assessment have suspected ischemic stroke as cause for admission reside in a residential care home are unable to walk prior to current illness. are pregnant/breastfeeding have a current diagnosis of diabetic ketoacidosis or hyperglycemic hyperosmolar syndrome
